required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Concordance Study Comparing Insulin Treatments in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Open-Label, Parallel Group Treatment Concordance Study to Compare Insulin Use and Its Effect on Glycemic Control in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Two Populations With Different Insulin Treatment Options

brief_summary.textblock: A study to compare insulin use and its effect on glucose control and other outcomes in patients with Type 2 diabetes who together with their healthcare provider manage their disease by discussing and agreeing on the diabetes treatment chosen from a selection of available treatment options.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess acceptance of insulin therapy
To assess blood sugar control as measured by HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure changes in HbA1c over time
To assess safety by review of adverse events
To assess patient-reported outcomes based on the W-BQ12 questionnaire
To assess patient-reported outcomes based on the DSC-R questionnaire
To assess patient-reported outcomes based on the DTSQ Questionnaire

arm_group.description: Treatment options available on the market plus the option of taking Human Insulin Inhalation Powder.
Treatment Options available on the market.

intervention.description: patient specific dose, inhaled, before meals, 9 months ( if patient chooses Human Insulin Inhalation Powder option)
patient specific dose, oral or injectable, before meals and/or as needed, 9 months. ( patients and investigator determine standard option therapy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 Diabetes
- Insulin-naive
- Non-smoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant pulmonary, hepatic or renal disease
- severe congestive heart failure
- active malignancy or malignancy within the last 5 years
- systemic glucocorticoid therapy

results_reference.citation: Bergenstal RM, Freemantle N, Leyk M, Cutler GB Jr, Hayes RP, Muchmore DB. Does availability of AIR insulin increase insulin use and improve glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes? Diabetes Technol Ther. 2009 Sep;11 Suppl 2:S45-52. doi: 10.1089/dia.2009.0028.

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
